title: Looking to buy my white whale… Red Portrait Ty Cobb
author: Belfast1933

posts.post_title: Looking to buy my white whale… Red Portrait Ty Cobb
posts.post_content:
Am in the market for adding my “white whale to my personal collection….

I’ll be in the market very soon for a great eye appeal, well centered T206 Red Portrait Ty Cobb

Please PM me if you have something that might be available or available soon

Thx so much!

Jeff

(Adding this image below for impact, not my card… isn’t this a beauty of a card of the great Cobb??)

Good luck Jeff! I hope you’re able to find something that fits your condition and budget requirements!  It’s a beautiful card. 

Bill

[quote name="fkm_bky" post=2200150]Good luck Jeff! I hope you’re able to find something that fits your condition and budget requirements!  It’s a beautiful card. 

Bill[/QUOTE]

Thx Bill!  It will be a fun journey…

Bumpsky… still looking for lower grade red potrait Cobb, best I can get for $4-5k

Thx,

Jeff

A twitter-friend of mine, who I’m pretty sure is a member of the board, just put one up in your range: [url]https://twitter.com/johnmorton215/status/1503159307634118657?s=21[/url]


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

[quote name="grandcards" post=2205460]A twitter-friend of mine, who I’m pretty sure is a member of the board, just put one up in your range: [url]https://twitter.com/johnmorton215/status/1503159307634118657?s=21[/url]


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk[/QUOTE]

Many thanks, Dan!  Yes, he and I have been in touch… nice one but not quite right for me. Still hunting!

Bump… with a twist?

Am still looking for my Red Portrait Cobb and have had some great inquiries here so far. Might have an opportunity to buy soon from a Net54 member. 

Here’s a twist - if anyone is both coin AND card collector, I’d love to put this beautiful pair of 1910 and 1911 $5 Indian Head gold coin cufflinks toward my Cobb. They have total weight of 29.2 grams and the accent gold is available 14kt

I got some great advice on the water cooler section here and figure these are probably worth $1500-2000 (I already have 2 offers from local dealers for about $1400)

I thought I might take a chance to see if anyone might be interested in these coin/cufflinks toward your Red Portrait Cobb. Probably a long shot that a Cobb seller is also a coin collector but you can’t score if you don’t shoot, Gretzky!

See images below. 

Thx

Jeff

Bumpsky… still looking for a nice looking lower grade Red Cobb if anyone has one to move

Have been lucky enough to build up funds to finally make a big splash for my collection - some active auctions look interesting and have been in touch with 1-2 Net54 members. 

But if you have one to move, would love to hear from you also before I pull the trigger. 

Thx again

Jeff
